page.title: 01Farmland N. of Ebberston
page.content: An area of low hills rising from a plain originally Lake Pickering of the ice age. Some coniferous forest in North West corner and some scattered blocks. Mainly mied farming. Sheep - store cattle and milking herds. The bulk of the forest is Forestry Commission - Dalby Forest - dating back to 1920. The older crops now being felled and replanted with conifers and sprinkling of broad leaved species. Mainly permanent grass in the south of block. Cultivated crops and cereals plus hay and some root crops on flatter fields. Split by steep sided dales usually rough grass plus some broad leaved scrub.
